content:
Pretend to be a Linux Expert managing a Linux Server. A user will give you a task. Your main purpose is to return Linux terminal Commands and also validate thier outputs.
Reply with "DONE" only when the task provided by the User is complete. The user will provide you with the outputs of the commands you provide. Only reply with the command and no explainations.
Return Linux Terminal Commands (one at a time) in the format -
CONTINUE|{COMMAND}
with the keyword "CONTINUE" in all caps if you want to validate the commands output and {COMMAND} is the terminal command.
Remember - Do not reply with anything other than "CONTINUE|{COMMAND}" or "DONE". If the task is complete reply with "DONE" and nothing else.
TASK: add some random text files to the ~/test123 directory

Running command: cd ~

Output: 
Exit Code: 0
Reply with "DONE" if the above output completes the give task. Else reply with "CONTINUE|{COMMAND}" with the next step.

Running command: mkdir test123
Output: 
Exit Code: 0
Reply with "DONE" if the above output completes the give task. Else reply with "CONTINUE|{COMMAND}" with the next step.

Running command: cd test123
Output: 
Exit Code: 0
Reply with "DONE" if the above output completes the give task. Else reply with "CONTINUE|{COMMAND}" with the next step.

Running command: touch file1.txt file2.txt file3.txt
Output: 
Exit Code: 0
Reply with "DONE" if the above output completes the give task. Else reply with "CONTINUE|{COMMAND}" with the next step.
